definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just

sentences.english: as you hear it a second time it startles less.
sentences.chinese: 但听到第二声的时候，就没那么吃惊了。

sentences.english: When two 3rd tones are in succession, the first 3rd tone is pronounced as a 2nd tone.
sentences.chinese: 两个第三声连在一起时，前一个读成第二声。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
